result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas William Wontor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count 2 and current revocation sentence
Consecutive to: Count 2 and current revocation sentence

miscConds.notes: Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA Surcharge- payment to be worked out with agent.

No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid Rx. No THC for any reason. May not enter the State of Michigan for any reason. No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in a treatment setting and only with prior agent approval.
Provide complete and truthful testimony. Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. Obtain and maintain full time employment. DNA Sample Due: 6-20-22.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
3:06 PM Defendant Nicholas William Wontor in court.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Nicholas William Wontor. 
Court calls case.
Atty Hansen provides plea form.
DA moves to amend Count 1 to Possession of THC as a repeater.
Will file an amended information.
Atty Hansen agrees.
Court accepts the amended charge.
DA heard on agreement.
Court arraigns Deft on the amended Count 1 w/ repeater.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 2 w/ repeater.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
Plea Ques / WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Elements of offense.
Court reviews prior conviction.
Deft agrees.
DA agrees.
Atty Hansen agrees.
Atty Hansen satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to the Amended Count 1 and Count 2.
DA heard on sentencing.
3:31 off record.
3:32 back on record.
Atty Hansen heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 1: 
18 months initial confinement, 6 months extended supervision consecutive to Count 2 and current revocation sentence, and places deft on probation for 2 years, consecutive to present sentence.
Not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Conditions of probation:
Provide complete and truthful testimony as requested.
Payment of $100 fine + costs + service fees + DNA surcharge - payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
No THC for any reason.
May not enter the State of Michigan for any reason.
No contact with known drug users or sellers except in treatment and only with prior agent approval.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
DNA sample due 06-20-2022.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 2: 
18 months initial confinement, 6 months extended supervision consecutive to Count 1 and current revocation sentence, and places deft on probation for 2 years, consecutive to present sentence.
Not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Conditions of probation:
Provide complete and truthful testimony as requested.
Payment of DNA surcharge only - payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today, without a valid prescription.
No THC for any reason.
May not enter the State of Michigan for any reason.
No contact with known drug users or sellers except in treatment and only with prior agent approval.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
DNA sample due 06-20-2022.
Appeal rights.
3:40 PM

Attachment to Information

Attachment to Information

3:20 PM Defendant Nicholas William Wontor appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court, via video means, for Nicholas William Wontor.
Prelim quest/WOR provided - Atty Hansen satisfied.
Def waives prelim
Court finds def freely waives prelim
Def bound over for trial 
Court moves to arraignment today.
DA heard - info will track comp.
Atty Hansen - provided info track comp, enters n/g pleas, requests STC.
Court schedules w/parties.
3:26 pm
Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

08:48 AM Defendant Nicholas William Wontor in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Nicholas William Wontor in custody.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicholas William Wontor appeared by video means.
Court calls case.
Atty Hansen heard - has reviewed complaint with deft.
Deft understands.
Requests prelim within time limits.
Court schedules.
8:49 AM
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
11:20 AM Defendant Nicholas William Wontor in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Nicholas William Wontor in custody.  DeShea D. Morrow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Nicholas William Wontor appeared by video means.
Court calls case.
Atty Brad Hansen is present from PD's office for bond purposes only.
Deft does qualify for PD representation.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
DA heard on bond recommendations.
Atty Hansen heard on bond.
Court imposes $2,500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances and including THC w/o a valid Rx.
Court schedules with parties.
11:25 AM
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
